content.description: 4 bolts to anchors, a fun little route on great holds somewhat reminiscent of a red river gorge 5.9 minus the length
content.protection: Now has anchors at the top, 4 bolts
content.location: 3rd route along the approach trail (3rd route to the left of the cliff break)

content.description: Balancy climbing down low (crux) leads to slopers, then a huge ledge. Swim on chicken heads to the top.
content.location: Rightmost line in the amphitheater. Shares 4 bolts with X-Box 360, then breaks right.

content.description: After the balancy start, the crux is pulling the bulge on the second half of the route.
content.location: Right side of amphitheater. Shares 1st 4 bolts with X-Files then breaks left.

content.description: This was a very dirty climb but I think it climbs really well now that its had a scrub. Will only get better with traffic, super fun movement and now has anchors so you don't have to swim through mud at the top to sling a tree.
content.protection: Now equipped with anchors. I found it extremely useful to have a #5 - I also bumped it a few times. Could see someone wanting doubles #3-5 if not comfortable with bumping.
content.location: Obvious twin crack feature on your way to the main area x wall - this is the right of the twin cracks.

content.description: I doubt this thing had seen an ascent in some time but after some scrubbing its a real fun climb. Now that it has anchors definitely worth a pull! I knocked down a lot of the loose stuff but as this thing gets more traffic it will get better and better.
content.protection: Do not skimp on the big stuff. I'd say doubles of 3, 4  and singles from .3 to 2. Now equipped with anchors.
content.location: Obvious "twin crack" feature on your way to x-files, squirrel nuts, etc. This is the crack which is to climbers left.

content.description:
The very last route in the Obed (furthest down river).

 The crux is the route'e namesake - get set up on bad holds and go for the the hold either 'thunk' and you hit it or you don't. Very hard for the grade...
content.location: The last bolted route on the cliffline and on the Obed River.

content.description: Starts on slopers and smeary feet, then after breaking right it climbs through the tiered roofs.
content.location: Starts the same as Squirrel Nuts, then breaks right and goes straight up the amphitheater.

content.description: Starts at the base of squirrel nuts and climbs through the flake up and left with good and plentiful protection to a short traverse to the anchor of Thunk

This route is pure fun, follow the bolt line to the right of thunk (the last route on the cliff line) and hang left when the line splits (follow right for the 12a). The route is overhanging with great holds and nice movement.
content.location: Just to the (climber's) right of Thunk

content.description: Climb left of a prow to a mini roof, then swim up to the anchors.
content.location: First bolted line at Area X seen after crossing the creek.

content.description: Start on slopy crimps with good feet, then high step your way to chicken heads at the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts to brand new quick links
content.location: Soon after crossing the creek, follow the cliff on your right until you see a blank face just left of a prow.

content.description: Furthest routes down the Obed river. Routes here are usually in the shade, its a great place to climb in the summer. Host to some of the best 11s on the Obed river and very secluded, you'll almost never see another party out here!
